title: 2.5 Master Challenge 3
question:
The following table helps to calculate the monthly pension a person is entitled to based on the years of service and salary drawn per month upon retirement. For example, a person who served for 10 years and took home a salary of $2500 per month at the time of retirement would get 14% of $2500 as a pension per month.

Note: Monthly pension = % based on years of service* last drawn monthly salary Write a Java program to calculate the monthly pension amount for different years of services and last drawn monthly salary.
1. Ask the user to input the service year and then input the monthly salary.
2. Using conditional and compound boolean expressions to determine the monthly pension after retirement.
